articles.title: Bed Bath & Beyond staves off bankruptcy with $225 mln from stock sale
articles.description: Bed Bath & Beyond Inc said on Tuesday it raised about $225 million in an equity offering and may get another $800 million over the next 10 months, as the struggling retailer tries to avoid bankruptcy.
articles.content:
Feb 7 (Reuters) - Bed Bath & Beyond Inc (BBBY.O) said on Tuesday it raised about $225 million in an equity offering and may get another $800 million over the next 10 months, as the struggling retailer tries to avoid bankruptcy.

articles.title: Church of England to consider use of gender-neutral terms for God
articles.description: Use of ‘he’ when referring to God to be examined by new a commission in spring
articles.content:
The Church of England is considering whether to stop referring to God as “he”, after priests asked to be allowed to use gender-neutral terms instead.
The church said it would launch a new commission on the matter in the spring. Any potential alterati... [2837 chars]

articles.title: Newborn, toddler saved from rubble in quake-hit Syrian town
articles.description: JINDERIS, Syria (AP) — Residents digging through a collapsed building in a northwest Syrian town discovered a crying infant whose mother appears to have given birth to her while buried underneath the rubble from this week’s devastating earthquake , relatives and a doctor said Tuesday.
articles.content:
In the northwestern Syrian town of Jinderis, a girl has been dug out from under a collapsed building.
In the northwestern Syrian town of Jinderis, a girl has been dug out from under a collapsed building.

articles.title: Trudeau offers premiers $46.2B in new funding for health-care
articles.description: The federal government is pledging to increase health funding to Canada's provinces and territories by $196.1 billion over the next 10 years, in a long-awaited deal aimed at addressing Canada's crumbling health-care systems with $46.2 billion in new funding.
articles.content:

articles.description: A elderly woman has died in hospital after being hit by a tram in Melbourne.

articles.title: HS2: ministers to cut services and speeds to drive down costs, reports say
articles.description: Number of trains could be cut from from 18 to 10 an hour and maximum speed of 360 km/h (224 mph) may be reduced
articles.content:
Ministers are planning on cutting HS2 services and train speeds in an attempt to drive down the cost of the heavily delayed project, it has been reported.

articles.title: Cross-channel wrap: Lyons scores, Wrexham bow out
articles.description: Ex-Bohemians and Shamrock Rovers wing back Andy Lyons scored his first goal for Blackpool tonight, his late strike teeing up a chaotic finish in their 2-2 home draw against Huddersfield Town in the Championship.

articles.title: A-Leagues to launch inaugural Pride Celebration round to coincide with Mardi Gras and 2023 Sydney World Pride
articles.description: Following the success of the 2022 Pride Cup, the APL will introduce a league-wide initiative to celebrate the LGBTQIA+ community and combat homophobia.

articles.title: Syria: newborn pulled alive from earthquake rubble while mother dies
articles.description: Relatives find baby girl tied by umbilical cord to mother who died in Monday’s massive earthquake
articles.content:
A newborn baby girl has been pulled alive from the rubble of a home in northern Syria, after relatives found her still tied by her umbilical cord to her mother, who died in Monday’s massive earthquake.
